_source.content: Biden is showing America you don't need to work to pay for things,we as Republicans must fight back 🇺🇸 President Joe Biden’s announced that up to $20,000 of student loans would be forgiven, Republicans are proposing actions to stop Biden’s plan in court. The thought that Biden plans to use hard-working taxpayer money to relieve student loan burdens is a misuse of funds and a handout to “elites,” according to several GOP members. Attorney General Eric Schmidt (R-MO) said that his office is “actively looking into legal options to halt the Biden administration’s abuse of power and assault on working-class Americans.” Some believe it isn’t fair to cancel student loan debt while so many others have had to work overtime in order to pay theirs off. “Eighty-five percent of Americans don’t have a student loan… I had a student loan. I had to pay it off,”  Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) said during a rally. Meanwhile Group founder Grover Norquist told the Washington Examiner that the reason why the Biden White House didn’t go through Democrat-controlled Congress, is because the massive debt cancellation effort failed to get enough support from centrist Democrats to pass. Jim Kessler, executive vice president for policy at the centrist Democratic think tank Third Way, said the “plan is "fiscally reckless, unjustified on policy grounds, likely unconstitutional, politically fraught."He also argued that there is no constitutional justification to cancel student loan debt, claiming that members of Congress may be able to bring a case to court against the Biden administration for bypassing Congress’s powers. #maga2024 #studentloans #trump2024 #makeAmericagreatagain
_source.contentraw:
Biden is showing America you don't need to work to pay for things,we as Republicans must fight back 🇺🇸

President Joe Biden’s announced that up to $20,000 of student loans would be forgiven, Republicans are proposing actions to stop Biden’s plan in court. The thought that Biden plans to use hard-working taxpayer money to relieve student loan burdens is a misuse of funds and a handout to “elites,” according to several GOP members.

Attorney General Eric Schmidt (R-MO) said that his office is “actively looking into legal options to halt the Biden administration’s abuse of power and assault on working-class Americans.” Some believe it isn’t fair to cancel student loan debt while so many others have had to work overtime in order to pay theirs off.

“Eighty-five percent of Americans don’t have a student loan… I had a student loan. I had to pay it off,” Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) said during a rally.

Meanwhile Group founder Grover Norquist told the Washington Examiner that the reason why the Biden White House didn’t go through Democrat-controlled Congress, is because the massive debt cancellation effort failed to get enough support from centrist Democrats to pass. Jim Kessler, executive vice president for policy at the centrist Democratic think tank Third Way, said the “plan is "fiscally reckless, unjustified on policy grounds, likely unconstitutional, politically fraught."He also argued that there is no constitutional justification to cancel student loan debt, claiming that members of Congress may be able to bring a case to court against the Biden administration for bypassing Congress’s powers.

#maga2024 #studentloans #trump2024 #makeAmericagreatagain

card.description: New court documents show that the FBI planned for months to seize and forfeit property found inside safe deposit boxes in an L.A. raid under the pretext of doing an inventory.
card.title: FBI misled judge in obtaining warrant to seize hundreds of safe deposit boxes

_source.content: FBI Misled Judge in Obtaining Warrant To Seize Hundreds of Safe Deposit BoxesReason ^ | 8/19/22 | Eric Boehmhttps://reason.com/2022/08/19/fbi-misled-judge-in-obtaining-warrant-to-seize-hundreds-of-safe-deposit-boxes/The FBI told a federal magistrate judge that it intended to open hundreds of safe deposit boxes seized during a March 2021 raid in order to inventory the items inside - but new evidence shows that federal agents were plotting all along to use the operation as an opportunity to forfeit cash and other valuables.Federal agents failed to disclose those plans to the federal magistrate judge who issued the warrant for the high-profile raid of U.S. Private Vaults, a private business in Beverly Hills, California, that had been the subject of an FBI investigation since at least 2019. When the raid took place, the FBI also seems to have ignored limitations imposed by the warrant, including an explicit prohibition against using the safe deposit boxes as the basis for further criminal investigations.Those details regarding the planning and execution of the FBI's raid of U.S. Private Vaults are now out in the open after a different federal judge ruled this week that the government could not keep those details out of the public record. As Reason has extensively reported, the raid on U.S. Private Vaults resulted in federal agents seizing and attempting to forfeit more than $86 million in cash as well as gold, jewelry, and other valuables from property owners who were suspected of no crimes. Attorneys representing some plaintiffs who are trying to recover their possessions interviewed the FBI agents who planned the raid, but federal prosecutors tried to keep some details of those depositions redacted.The unredacted legal documents, filed in federal court on Thursday, show why the government was eager to keep those details under wraps. (Reason submitted an amicus brief in the case arguing that the redacted documents should be made public.)
_source.contentraw:
FBI Misled Judge in Obtaining Warrant To Seize Hundreds of Safe Deposit Boxes
Reason ^ | 8/19/22 | Eric Boehm
https://reason.com/2022/08/19/fbi-misled-judge-in-obtaining-warrant-to-seize-hundreds-of-safe-deposit-boxes/

The FBI told a federal magistrate judge that it intended to open hundreds of safe deposit boxes seized during a March 2021 raid in order to inventory the items inside - but new evidence shows that federal agents were plotting all along to use the operation as an opportunity to forfeit cash and other valuables.

Federal agents failed to disclose those plans to the federal magistrate judge who issued the warrant for the high-profile raid of U.S. Private Vaults, a private business in Beverly Hills, California, that had been the subject of an FBI investigation since at least 2019. When the raid took place, the FBI also seems to have ignored limitations imposed by the warrant, including an explicit prohibition against using the safe deposit boxes as the basis for further criminal investigations.

Those details regarding the planning and execution of the FBI's raid of U.S. Private Vaults are now out in the open after a different federal judge ruled this week that the government could not keep those details out of the public record. As Reason has extensively reported, the raid on U.S. Private Vaults resulted in federal agents seizing and attempting to forfeit more than $86 million in cash as well as gold, jewelry, and other valuables from property owners who were suspected of no crimes. Attorneys representing some plaintiffs who are trying to recover their possessions interviewed the FBI agents who planned the raid, but federal prosecutors tried to keep some details of those depositions redacted.

The unredacted legal documents, filed in federal court on Thursday, show why the government was eager to keep those details under wraps. (Reason submitted an amicus brief in the case arguing that the redacted documents should be made public.)

Another Busload of Illegal Migrants Arrive in NYC

Another busload of illegal migrants arrived New York City from Texas on Saturday, bringing the number of illegals shipped there to 1,500.
According to Gov. Greg Abbott (R-TX) 96 illegal migrants were transported on two buses, in effort to bring attention to the thousands of migrants crossing the southern border daily at the hands of President Joe Biden’s bad policies.
>>“Texas is filling the gaps left in Biden’s absence at our border… We’ve made over 19,000 arrests, seized over 335.5M lethal fentanyl doses, & sent over 7,400 migrants on buses to DC and over 1,500 to NYC. While Biden ignores the crisis, Texas steps up,” Abbott said in a tweet.
Reports say that the illegal migrants are being housed in 14 hotels across the Big Apple because the city’s shelter system is overloaded.
As part of Operation Lone Star, Abbott previously said he decided its time for the Biden administration to see the problem they created, and then walked away from.
>>“President Biden’s continued refusal to acknowledge the crisis caused by his open border policies,” Abbott said, adding “the State of Texas has had to take unprecedented action to keep our communities safe.”
The Texas governor chose New York City and Washington D.C. as a destination for the illegals because both of the Democrat-run cities have said they would welcome the migrants with open arms, that is before they thought they would have to actually deal with the crisis themselves.
>>“They can receive the abundance of city services and housing that Mayor Eric Adams has boasted about within the sanctuary city,” Abbott said earlier this month.
He said he hopes the liberal mayors will follow through with their promises of welcoming all migrants with open arms so “that our overrun and overwhelmed border towns can find relief.”

card.title: Biden is Showing America You Don't Need To Work To Pay For Things, Republicans Are Fighting Back

_source.content: Biden is Showing America You Don't Need To Work To Pay For Things, Republicans Are Fighting Back Following President Joe Biden’s announcement that up to $20,000 of student loans would be forgiven, Republicans are proposing actions to stop Biden’s plan in court. The thought that Biden plans to use hard-working taxpayer money to relieve student loan burdens is a misuse of funds and a handout to “elites,” according to several GOP members. Attorney General Eric Schmidt (R-MO) said that his office is “actively looking into legal options to halt the Biden administration’s abuse of power and assault on working-class Americans.” Some believe it isn’t fair to cancel student loan debt while so many others have had to work overtime in order to pay theirs off. >>“Eighty-five percent of Americans don’t have a student loan… I had a student loan. I had to pay it off,”  Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) said during a rally. Meanwhile Group founder Grover Norquist told the Washington Examiner that the reason why the Biden White House didn’t go through Democrat-controlled Congress, is because the massive debt cancellation effort failed to get enough support from centrist Democrats to pass. >>Jim Kessler, executive vice president for policy at the centrist Democratic think tank Third Way, said the “plan is "fiscally reckless, unjustified on policy grounds, likely unconstitutional, politically fraught."He also argued that there is no constitutional justification to cancel student loan debt, claiming that members of Congress may be able to bring a case to court against the Biden administration for bypassing Congress’s powers. Meanwhile the American Action Network released a new ad mocking Biden’s plan and liberal activists who support student loan forgiveness. >>“Biden's right — you should take my tax dollars to pay off your debts. My family will figure out how to get by with less. What's most important is we spare college graduates from any extra stress." A mechanic follows up: "Wanna be a struggling artist? College is on me,” the ad says.https://townhall.com/tipsheet/saraharnold/2022/08/28/republicans-are-fighting-back-against-bidens-student-loan-forgiveness-plans-n2612335
_source.contentraw:
Biden is Showing America You Don't Need To Work To Pay For Things, Republicans Are Fighting Back

Following President Joe Biden’s announcement that up to $20,000 of student loans would be forgiven, Republicans are proposing actions to stop Biden’s plan in court.
The thought that Biden plans to use hard-working taxpayer money to relieve student loan burdens is a misuse of funds and a handout to “elites,” according to several GOP members.
Attorney General Eric Schmidt (R-MO) said that his office is “actively looking into legal options to halt the Biden administration’s abuse of power and assault on working-class Americans.”
Some believe it isn’t fair to cancel student loan debt while so many others have had to work overtime in order to pay theirs off.
>>“Eighty-five percent of Americans don’t have a student loan… I had a student loan. I had to pay it off,” Sen. Marco Rubio (R-FL) said during a rally.
Meanwhile Group founder Grover Norquist told the Washington Examiner that the reason why the Biden White House didn’t go through Democrat-controlled Congress, is because the massive debt cancellation effort failed to get enough support from centrist Democrats to pass.
>>Jim Kessler, executive vice president for policy at the centrist Democratic think tank Third Way, said the “plan is "fiscally reckless, unjustified on policy grounds, likely unconstitutional, politically fraught."
He also argued that there is no constitutional justification to cancel student loan debt, claiming that members of Congress may be able to bring a case to court against the Biden administration for bypassing Congress’s powers.
Meanwhile the American Action Network released a new ad mocking Biden’s plan and liberal activists who support student loan forgiveness.
>>“Biden's right — you should take my tax dollars to pay off your debts. My family will figure out how to get by with less. What's most important is we spare college graduates from any extra stress." A mechanic follows up: "Wanna be a struggling artist? College is on me,” the ad says.
https://townhall.com/tipsheet/saraharnold/2022/08/28/republicans-are-fighting-back-against-bidens-student-loan-forgiveness-plans-n2612335

_source.content: Der deutsche Rumpfstaat wird schon seit Jahrzehnten auf allen Ebenen umfassend zerstörthttps://www.focus.de/perspektiven/gastbeitrag-von-eric-schweitzer-ohne-putins-gas-droht-der-deutschen-industrie-der-kollaps-was-jetzt-zu-tun-ist_id_128011005.html – Man kann mal wieder nur den Kopf schütteln, da viele Leute scheinbar hinter dem Mond leben. Es mag zwar wahr sein, daß eine Einstellung der russischen Erdgaslieferungen einen Zusammenbruch der deutschen Volkswirtschaft auslösen könnte, aber es ist doch keinesfalls so, daß dem deutschen Rumpfstaat ohne den erneuerten amerikanischen Handelskrieg gegen Rußland eine glänzende Zukunft beschieden gewesen wäre. Da hätten wir zum einen das leidige Problem der Umvolkung, also die Verdrängung unserer deutschen Urbevölkerung durch Neger und Muselmannen. Deren wirtschaftliche Folgen unbestreitbar sind. So haben etwa die Dänen neulich nachgerechnet und herausgefunden, daß die Neger und Muselmannen stets weitaus mehr Geld vom Staat erhalten als sie diesem einbringen. https://exxpress.at/daenemark-migranten-aus-islamischen-laendern-erhalten-mehr-als-sie-einzahlen Sprich, je mehr wir Deutschen also durch diese verdrängt werden, desto weniger leistungsfähig wird die Volkswirtschaft des deutschen Rumpfstaates sein. Es hat ja seinen Grund, warum Afrika und Arabien so aussehen wie sie aussehen und deren Bewohner allesamt nach Europa strömen.Dann kommt die weltanschauliche Verblendung der hiesigen Grünen zum Tragen. Die grünen Spinner hassen die Atomkraft wie Pest und haben zudem alles im Klimawahn auf Erdgas umgestellt, weil dieses angeblich weniger Kohlenstoff bei der Verbrennung in die Luft ausstößt. Aus diesem Grund allein sind unsere Industrieproduktion und unsere Stromerzeugung so stark vom russischen Erdgas abhängig. Dabei haben wir große Vorräte an Stein- und Braunkohle, welche mehrere Jahrhunderte unseren Bedarf decken könnten, im eigenen Land. Hinzu kommt, daß der Bruch zwischen den Amerikanern und Russen seit den Jahren 2008 und 2014 absehbar war. Man hätte also schon vor Jahren allerlei Gegenmaßnahmen ergreifen können. Von heute auf morgen stellt man eben keine neuzeitliche Volkswirtschaft um. Als besetztes Land vermag der deutsche Rumpfstaat sich seine Handelspartner eben nicht frei zu wählen. Zumal die Amerikaner nicht davor zurückschrecken auch zu unerlaubten Mitteln zu greifen und das Klimakommando Luisa Neubauer in der Ostsee in Erscheinung treten lassen könnten... https://www.abendblatt.de/politik/ausland/article106842108/Pipeline-Crash-in-Russland-es-war-die-CIA.htmlVon Seiten der liberalen Amerikanerhandpuppen scheinen auch überhaupt keine Bestrebungen vorhanden zu sein, die Wirtschaftskraft des deutschen Rumpfstaates zu erhalten. So haben diese etwa die Volkswirtschaft die letzten zwei Jahre wegen der Scheinseuche Korona mutwillig an die Wand gefahren und haben fast vier Fünftel der Einwohner einen unerprobten Impfstoff verabreicht. Die langfristigen Folgen für die Volksgesundheit lassen sich nur vermuten. Und auch in der gegenwärtigen Gefahr wird nichts getan. Es könnten beispielsweise drei Kernkraftwerke weiterbetrieben und drei bereits abgeschaltete wieder in Betrieb genommen werden. https://www.n-tv.de/regionales/niedersachsen-und-bremen/Kritik-an-Spahns-Forderung-nach-AKW-Verlaengerung-article23531333.html Es hier keinesfalls sicher, ob den liberalen Amerikanerhandpuppen bewußt ist, daß die Leute elektrische Heizlüfter anschalten werden, wenn die Gasheizung ausfallen sollte. https://www.focus.de/finanzen/news/stresstest-soll-klarheit-bringen-heizluefter-boomen-welche-probleme-die-gas-alternative-im-winter-bereiten-kann_id_123166613.html Die entsprechende Mehrbelastung könnte dann dem Stromnetz den Rest geben. Dieses ist durch die Sonnenstromzellen und die Windstrommühlen ohnehin schon reichlich anfällig geworden. https://industriemagazin.at/artikel/noteingriffe-ins-stromnetz-kosten-deutschland-schon-1-4-mrd-euroHätte man im Februar gleich angefangen, so könnten einige neue Kohlekraftwerke im Herbst und Winter in Betrieb genommen werden. Ebenso hätte die heimische Kohleförderung bedeutend gesteigert werden können. Strom und Heizung müßten in diesem Herbst und Winter nicht ausfallen und das sollte man bei den kommenden Unruhen nicht vergessen. Das liebe Geld und irgendwelche Gesetze können hier von den liberalen Amerikanerhandpuppen übrigens nicht als Ausrede angeführt

group.description: „Wir leben in einer vom Lärm der Waffen hallenden Welt. Aufrüstung allerwärts, und wehe dem Land, das nicht imstande oder nicht gewillt ist, sich auf eigene Kraft zu verlassen. Wie glücklich sind diejenigen Völker vom Schicksal ausgestattet, deren Grenzen durch eine freundliche Natur stark, die durch hohe, unwegsame Gebirgszüge oder durch weite Meere vor feindlichen Einbrüchen ganz oder wenigstens teilweise geschützt sind. Wie unsicher anderseits ist das Leben von Völkern, deren oft an sich schon kleiner Lebensraum vorwiegend offene Grenzen ausweist, an denen Nachbarn hausen, deren unruhiger Charakter, verbunden mit überragender Bewaffnung eine ständige Bedrohung bedeutet. Während die einen über große Rohstoff- und Kolonialgebiete verfügen und infolgedessen wirtschaftlich in Krieg und Frieden weitgehend unabhängig sind, besitzen andere, nicht minder lebensfähige, an Zahl oftmals größere Völker nur eine sehr geringe Rohstoffbasis und kleine oder gar keine Kolonialgebiete; sie befinden sich daher in ständiger wirtschaftlichen Schwierigkeiten und sind nicht in der Lage, einen langen Krieg zu ertragen. Es leuchtet ein, daß die Unerträglichkeit lang dauernder kriegerischer Verwicklungen mit ihrer unvermeidlichen wirtschaftlichen Verelendung diejenigen Völker, die durch die geschichtliche Entwicklung und die Einsichtslosigkeit im Überfluß lebender anderer Nationen in eine solche Zwangslage geraten sind, zu der Überlegung zwingt, welche Mittel sich dazu eignen, einen bewaffneten Konflikt rasch zu einem erträglichen Ende zu führen. Die Hungersnot, die der Weltkrieg und die grausame Fortsetzung der Blockade nach dem Waffenstillstand für die Mittelmächte im Gefolge hatte, ist noch in zu frischer Erinnerung, als daß wir an dieser Frage nicht in höchstem Maße beteiligt wären. Wir wissen, daß – ungeachtet der im einzelnen vielleicht begangenen politischen und militärischen Führungsfehler – die Angriffskraft unseres Heeres 1914 nicht ausgereicht hat, um rasch zum Frieden zu gelangen. Das heißt, daß wir in der Bewaffnung, Ausrüstung und Organisation nicht vermocht hatten, der feindlichen Übermacht an Zahl ein Gegengewicht an Material entgegenzustellen. Wir glaubten, ein moralisches Übergewicht über unsere Gegner zu besitzen, und mögen in diesem Glauben recht gehabt haben. Allein dieses Übergewicht hat nicht genügt, um den Krieg zu gewinnen. Für die Zukunft ist es jedenfalls geraten, außer dem sittlichen und seelischen Zustand des Volkes, der sicher von ausschlaggebender Bedeutung ist, auch dem materiellen gebührende Aufmerksamkeit zu schenken. Ein Volk, das mit dem Kampf gegen Übermacht und mehrere Fronten rechnen muß, darf nichts vernachlässigen, was seine Lage erleichtern könnte.“ (Heinz Guderian, Achtung Panzer!)

_source.content: MATTHEW 7:21-23 (GW)“Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord!’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the person who does what my Father in heaven wants. Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name? Didn’t we force out demons and do many miracles by the power and authority of your name?’ Then I will tell them publicly, ‘I’ve never known you. Get away from me, you evil people.’(”)2 TIMOTHY 3:5 (GW)They will appear to have a godly life, but they will not let its power change them. Stay away from such people.https://www.biblegateway.com/Cults and false religions in a nutshell, right there. Meanwhile, forever’s a long time.Tends to make one wonder why people gamble like that.There are literally dozens of each, cults and false religions. Some of the more mainstream of these who tend to focus on that “salvation by works” stuff (despite Matthew 5:13-16, Isaiah 64:6, Ephesians 2:8-10 and Titus 3:4-8) are (on the cult side) Seventh Day Adventism, Jehovah’s Witnesses, Mormons, the Hebrew Roots Movement and Roman Catholicism. On the false religions side, it’s Judaism which denies Jesus as The Messiah, again the Hebrew Roots Movement and again Roman Catholicism. (The Hebrew Roots Movement as well as Roman Catholicism are both a cult AND a false religion, Biblically-speaking.) Sadly, Matthew 7:21-23, Galatians 3:1-3 and 2 Timothy 3:5 are STELLAR descriptions of cults and false religions. “I’m glad I listened,” before it’s too late ALWAYS sounds better than, “I wish I’d listened,” when it is.A “cult” is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong “Jesus”, but that’s another story), quote Scripture passages (WAY out of Biblical context) and fails to follow Him and Him ALONE. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. They do a good job of telling people about Jesus but fail to teach anyone about the finished work of Jesus or His Resurrection. There’s ALWAYS someone else as a “leader”. Examples: Charles “Taze” Russell of Jehovah’s Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on.(SIDE NOTE: Both the Hebrew Roots Movement and Roman Catholicism are both a cult AND a false religion, Biblically-speaking.) Salvation’s a GIFT, not a “WAGE” (Romans 6:23). He’s the CreatOR while we’re merely the creatED.The wrong “Jesus” exists in ANY cult which includes those “salvation by works” people. It’s totally impossible to “earn a gift”. No “Jesus” in false religions. One doesn’t HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesn’t teach anything like either “salvation by works” or “religion” (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with The Lord). By contrast, salvation is “Just Jesus. No artificial anything”. (“The Gospel ONLY”, in other words – Keyword: “ONLY”). Someone born again (or “born from above” – or “born anew” – John 3:1-6 – https://biblehub.com/greek/509.htm ) is only qualified to teach the new covenant (see 2 Corinthians 3:4-11 for more information). Forever’s a long time.False religions are false religions. Curses are curses (see Matthew 13:14-15, Matthew 27:25 and Romans 11:7-8 for more information on that curse put on Israel by The Lord for the higher-ups rejecting Jesus as the Messiah and instead handing Him over to the Romans to be crucified.

On the false religions side, it’s Judaism which denies Jesus as The Messiah, again the Hebrew Roots Movement and again Roman Catholicism. (The Hebrew Roots Movement as well as Roman Catholicism are both a cult AND a false religion, Biblically-speaking.) Sadly, Matthew 7:21-23, Galatians 3:1-3 and 2 Timothy 3:5 are STELLAR descriptions of cults and false religions. “I’m glad I listened,” before it’s too late ALWAYS sounds better than, “I wish I’d listened,” when it is.

A “cult” is deemed so because it claims to have faith in Jesus (wrong “Jesus”, but that’s another story), quote Scripture passages (WAY out of Biblical context) and fails to follow Him and Him ALONE. Additionally, there are no contradictions in Scripture...EVER. They do a good job of telling people about Jesus but fail to teach anyone about the finished work of Jesus or His Resurrection. There’s ALWAYS someone else as a “leader”. Examples: Charles “Taze” Russell of Jehovah’s Witnesses, Moses of the Hebrew Roots Movement (an offshoot of the false religion of Judaism), the pope/a priest/Mary of Roman Catholicism, Mary Baker Eddy of Christian Science, Joseph Smith of Latter Day Saints, L. Ron Hubbard of Scientology, Ellen White of Seventh Day Adventism, Eric vonAnderseck of Second Eighth Week Apostles and so on.
(SIDE NOTE: Both the Hebrew Roots Movement and Roman Catholicism are both a cult AND a false religion, Biblically-speaking.) Salvation’s a GIFT, not a “WAGE” (Romans 6:23). He’s the CreatOR while we’re merely the creatED.

The wrong “Jesus” exists in ANY cult which includes those “salvation by works” people. It’s totally impossible to “earn a gift”. No “Jesus” in false religions. One doesn’t HAVE TO do things pertaining to Christianity, he or she GETS to. HUMONGOUS difference.) Christianity doesn’t teach anything like either “salvation by works” or “religion” (see Romans 6:23 for more information). Additionally, Scripture is BEYOND clear in 2 Corinthians 5:8 (absent with the body = present with The Lord).

By contrast, salvation is “Just Jesus. No artificial anything”. (“The Gospel ONLY”, in other words – Keyword: “ONLY”). Someone born again (or “born from above” – or “born anew” – John 3:1-6 – https://biblehub.com/greek/509.htm ) is only qualified to teach the new covenant (see 2 Corinthians 3:4-11 for more information). Forever’s a long time.

False religions are false religions. Curses are curses (see Matthew 13:14-15, Matthew 27:25 and Romans 11:7-8 for more information on that curse put on Israel by The Lord for the higher-ups rejecting Jesus as the Messiah and instead handing Him over to the Romans to be crucified.
